intro: Phlegmariurus loxensis, commonly known as the Loxense Spikemoss, is a species of spikemoss belonging to the family Selaginellaceae. It is a terrestrial, evergreen plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a distinctive morphology with whorled leaves and a creeping stem that can form dense mats. Its reproductive structures include microsporangia and megasporangia, which are essential for its spore reproduction. Phlegmariurus loxensis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
